meanings.definition: The quality of being brave or courageous.
meanings.sent1: Her valiancies in the face of danger inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent2: The knight's valiancies on the battlefield were legendary.
meanings.sent3: Despite her small size, the kitten showed valiancies when confronting the big dog.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero's valiancies were compared to a shining beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The valiancies of the firefighters saved many lives during the fire.

meanings.definition: The act of showing courage or bravery.
meanings.sent1: The valiancies displayed by the soldiers in battle were commendable.
meanings.sent2: During the rescue mission, his valiancies were evident to all.
meanings.sent3: The valiancies of the squirrel trying to steal food from the bird feeder was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her valiancies in speaking up for what is right were like a shield against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The valiancies of the young boy facing his fears were truly inspiring.
